wikipedia_page.main: Captain Oliver Manners Sutton  (12 March 1896 – 16 August 1921) was a British First World War flying ace credited with seven aerial victories.

response: |5 || 11 May 1917@ 1840 || Sopwith Pup(A6168) || Type C || Destroyed || Walincourt || Shared with Major C. E. Sutcliffe, and Lieutenants Maurice Scott, Oliver Sutton, E. J. Y. Grevelink & M. B. Cole.
